math_problem.A3727: Denote by $P(n)$ the greatest prime divisor of $n$. Find all integers $n\geq 2$ for which \[P(n)+\lfloor\sqrt{n}\rfloor=P(n+1)+\lfloor\sqrt{n+1}\rfloor\] Instead of finding all integers $n\\geq 2$ for which $P(n)+\\lfloor\\sqrt{n}\\rfloor=P(n+1)+\\lfloor\\sqrt{n+1}\\rfloor$, simply find $k = p + 11$, where $p$ is the greatest prime divisor of the integer $n$ that satisfies the condition.
